titles.title: To provide that a nongovernmental person may use a private express for the private carriage of certain letters and packets without being penalized by the Postal Service, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Postal Operations and Services.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 2/3/1994--Introduced. Prohibits the U.S. Postal Service or the Attorney General from fining or otherwise penalizing any person who transmits by private express or other unlawful means, delivers to any agent thereof, or deposits at any appointed place any letter or packet. Amends the Federal criminal code to conform with this Act.
